channel.title: Video Splitter
channel.description:
I'm looking for a program that can split an avi file into multiple files. All the ones I've found just split from two points you select, every few seconds, or for specific sizes.
I need like a batch version of that. I need to set like 40 markers at different positions and it splits each of them into a separate file.
Anyone know of any program like this?

item.title: Video Splitter
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:8, topic:277034”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=365702.msg2774424#msg2774424 date=1241447380]

ffmpeg or mencoder.

Those should work great. Most video editing software uses one or the other as a backend anyway.

As to the second post, that will probably also work, it does on mpeg anyway, so it’s worth a try.
[/quote]

The point was, I captured the entire tape in one capture in my NLE, and for this project my teacher wants to see each individual clip logged and in a separate file.

I could very easily split it up in the NLE, but exporting each one as a single video would take just as long as capturing them back in.[/quote]

Setup a shell script to do what you want with ffmpeg or mencoder. I’ve done similar things.

Read full topic

item.title: Video Splitter
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:277034”][quote author=Rictoo link=topic=365702.msg2774326#msg2774326 date=1241439020]
ffmpeg or mencoder.
[/quote]

Those should work great. Most video editing software uses one or the other as a backend anyway.

As to the second post, that will probably also work, it does on mpeg anyway, so it’s worth a try.[/quote]

The point was, I captured the entire tape in one capture in my NLE, and for this project my teacher wants to see each individual clip logged and in a separate file.

I could very easily split it up in the NLE, but exporting each one as a single video would take just as long as capturing them back in.

Read full topic

item.title: Video Splitter
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Aivdemux is really nice for this kinda stuff.

I just tried it out with an .avi file I had, it worked great.

item.title: Video Splitter
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

That splits files, not movies.

I need to split a movie into separate watchable movie files.

VirtualDub so far has worked the best, because it remembers the last end point, so I can set the next start point from there and just select the next end point, but it’s still not great for tons of work at one time.

Read full topic
